messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2575
messages.messageBody:
<<I told him I'd kick his butt if he tried anything again and I showed him
my knife>>

Oh Dar,

I cried when I read this. I was a foster mom for several years and adopted
several of our foster kids. I also worked for years with teens at a mental
health clinic. I always had a special place in my heart for the kids that
were willing to fight back against real and perceived wrongs, that still
viewed themselves as something worth protecting.

Julie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2575
messages.msgSnippet: Paula,  sounds good to me!   Kelli sjogy@aol.com wrote: In a message dated 10/28/02 5:04:21 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
Paula, sounds good to me! <smile>
Kelli
sjogy@... wrote:
In a message dated 10/28/02 5:04:21 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
writes:

<< But I'm in the beginning of that too. I would love to have a little farm,
grow our own food and stuff, could have a little petting zoo for extra
income, thought I could sell home grown treats, crafts and things in a gift
shop. This would all be great for the kids too! Anyway, this is my little
dream. I'm quite convinced that I could make a go of it, my husband on the
other hand is much more 'realistic' than me. >>

This is just what Quinn wants to do, before he becomes a computer expert,
rock star and animal saver!

Paula
